Author: NoEscape
Description: The new NoEscape ransomware operation, targeting Windows, Linux, and VMware ESXi servers, is believed to be a rebrand of Avaddon, a ransomware gang that shut down and released its decryption keys in 2021.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Target: Multiple e-commerce sites using WooCommerce Payments
Description: Researchers from Wordfence reveal that attackers are conducting widespread exploitation of CVE-2023-28121, a critical WooCommerce Payments plugin to gain the privileges of any users, including administrators, on vulnerable WordPress installation.
Norwegian recycling and mining corporation Tomra is in the midst of an “extensive” cyberattack affecting its systems.
Customers of the Russian medical laboratory Helix are unable to receive their test results for several days due to an attempted ransomware attack that crippled the company's systems over the weekend.

Author: RedCurl
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T reveal that the Russian-speaking hacking group RedCurl attacked a “major Russian bank” to steal corporate secrets,

Author: RedCurl
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T reveal that the Russian-speaking hacking group RedCurl attacked an undisclosed Australian organization to steal corporate secrets,

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: TJX Companies is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Vitesco Technlogies is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Description: Japan Tobacco International USA is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Description: Netscout is named on the Cl0p website, among the victims of the attacks exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 Vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Pioneer Electronics is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: American automotive parts retailer Autozone, is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Warner Bros Discovery is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.
Henry Ford Health confirms that an email phishing scheme led to a data breach affecting 168,000 patients.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Quorum Federal Credit Union files a notice of data breach after discovering that a vulnerability within the file transfer software MOVEit resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access confidential customer data.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Milliman Solutions files a notice of data breach after discovering that one of the company’s vendors, Pension Benefit Information, experienced a data security incident involving the file sharing application MOVEit.
An unnamed group or individual claims responsibility for a a cyber attack to the plastic surgery practice Hankins & Sohn Plastic Surgery Associates and starts to leak data.

Author: Nulled
Description: The Nulled ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to LePipe

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: Commission for Communications Regulation for Ireland
Description: Commission for Communications Regulation, or ComReg, the general communications regulator for Ireland, is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Sound Community Bank files a notice of potential data breach after discovering that one of the company’s vendors used MOVEit to transfer Sound Community Bank customer information.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat and Clop AKA Cl0p
Description: Two ransomware actors, ALPHV/BlackCat and Clop list beauty company Estée Lauder on their data leak sites as a victim of separate attacks.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: U.S. manufacturer ITT is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Software firm Bluefin Payment Systems is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Software firm Ventiv Technology is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University of Alaska is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University of Alaska is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Description: The University of Delaware is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University of Idaho is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Loyola University is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University of Oklahoma is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University of Temple is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Wake Forest University is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University of Worcester is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: FIN8 (AKA Syssphinx)
Description: Researchers from Broadcom/Symantec reveal that the financially motivated cybercrime gang FIN8 has been observed deploying BlackCat ransomware payloads on networks backdoored using a revamped Sardonic malware version.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Citrix alerts customers of a critical-severity vulnerability (CVE-2023-3519) in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway that already has exploits in the wild, and “strongly urges” to install updated versions without delay.

Author: SophosEncrypt
Description: Cybersecurity vendor Sophos is being impersonated by a new ransomware-as-a-service called SophosEncrypt, with the threat actors using the company name for their operation.
The FBI warns of a surge in tech support scams targeting the elderly across the United States and urging victims to dispatch cash concealed within magazines or similar items through shipping firms.

Author: More than 100 individuals in Ukraine
Description: The Cyber ​​Police Department of the National Police of Ukraine dismantles another massive bot farm linked to more than 100 individuals, used to push Russian propaganda justifying Russia's war in Ukraine, to disseminate illegal content and personal information, and in various other fraudulent activities.

Author: Turla (AKA Secret Blizzard, KRYPTON, and UAC-0003)
Target: Defense sector in Ukraine and Eastern Europe
Description: Microsoft and the Ukraine CERT warn of new attacks by the Russian state-sponsored Turla group, targeting the defense industry and Microsoft Exchange servers with a new 'DeliveryCheck' (AKA CapiBar and GAMEDAY) malware backdoor.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Lazarus Group AKA Jade Sleet and TraderTraitor
Target: Developers in the blockchain, cryptocurrency, online gambling, and cybersecurity
Description: GitHub warns of a social engineering campaign targeting the accounts of developers in the blockchain, cryptocurrency, online gambling, and cybersecurity sectors to infect their devices with malware.
A cyberattack impacting Swedish software company Ortivus leaves at least two British ambulance services without access to electronic patient records.
George County is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The SANS Internet Storm Center warns that attackers are apparently trying to exploit two path traversal vulnerabilities in the ‘Stagil navigation for Jira – Menus & Themes’ plugin.
Adobe releases an emergency ColdFusion security update that fixes critical vulnerabilities, including a fix for new zero-days exploited in attacks.

Author: FakeSG
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new campaign, dubbed FakeSG, using compromised WordPress websites to display a custom landing page mimicking the victim's browser and distributing the NetSupport RAT.

Physicians Insurance A Mutual Company, its affiliate MedChoice Risk Retention Group, and its subsidiary Experix (collectively “Physicians Insurance”) file a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to an employee’s email account.
As many as 700,000 TikTok accounts in Turkey are compromised by a hack that allowed attackers to access users’ private information and control their accounts.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The NoEscape ransomware group hits Girardini Group, a manufacturer of stamps.

Author: AlphaTeam
Description: The AlphaTeam gang claims responsibility for attacking 10 Italian organizations using the same vulnerable CMS.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Flare identify more than 200,000 OpenAI credentials for sale on the dark web in the form of stealer logs.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Adobe announces another ColdFusion update to patch three new CVEs. One of them, CVE-2023-38205, is the bypass for CVE-2023-29298 that appears to be “exploited in the wild in limited attacks”.

Author: APT41 AKA Brass Typhoon, BARIUM and Winnti
Description: Researchers from Lookout reveal that the Chinese state-backed APT41 group is targeting Android devices with two newly discovered spyware strains dubbed WyrmSpy and DragonEgg.

Author: P2PInfect
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto discover P2PInfect, a new peer-to-peer (P2P) malware with self-spreading capabilities that targets Redis instances running on Internet-exposed Windows and Linux systems.
Tampa General Hospital discloses that the sensitive data of 1.2 million was stolen in a failed ransomware attack.

Researchers from Fortinet reveal that multiple distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) botnets are targeting CVE-2023-28771, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls for which patches have been available since April.
Researchers from Proofpoint identify a series of campaigns using fraudulent job offers to target university students.

Author: BundleBot
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new malware strain known as BundleBot, abusing the dotnet bundle (single-file), self-contained format and commonly distributed via Facebook Ads and compromised accounts leading to websites masquerading as regular program utilities, AI tools, and games.

Author: HotRat
Target: Multiple organizations in Thailand, Guyana, Libya, Suriname, Mali, Pakistan, Cambodia, South Africa, and India
Description: Researchers from Avast discover a new variant of the AsyncRAT malware dubbed HotRat, being distributed via free, pirated versions of popular software and utilities such as video games, image and sound editing software, and Microsoft Office.
Country: GY KH IN LY ML PK SR TH ZA

Author: Rhysida
Description: 8,600 counseling records and about 100 people’s government-issued identification numbers are stolen in a Rhysida ransomware attack at Stephen F. Austin State University.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: TSG Interactive US Services Limited (d/b/a PokerStars)
Description: PokerStars is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Franklin Mint Federal Credit Union is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Pacific Premier Bank files documents with the Securities and Exchange Commission describing a third-party data breach involving a vendor’s use of MOVEit

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Pension Benefits Information (PBI) files a notice of data breach on behalf of Willis Towers Watson (WTW) after discovering that experienced a MOVEit-related breach at PBI affected confidential information that had been provided to WTW.

Target: U.S. organization in the critical infrastructure sector
Description: The US government warns that threat actors breached the network of a U.S. organization in the critical infrastructure sector after exploiting the zero-day RCE vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-3519, a critical-severity issue in NetScaler ADC and Gateway.

Author: Kanti
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a new strain of ransomware dubbed “Kanti” targeting cryptocurrency users.

Author: Mallox (AKA TargetCompany, Fargo, and Tohnichi)
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal a peak of activity by the Mallox ransomware group.
Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe, a globla law firm, notifies nearly 153,000 individuals of a hacking incident that compromised several client files.

MSX International files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access, and potentially remove, confidential consumer data stored on the company’s computer network.
Rite Aid Corporation posts a Security Incident Notice after learning that a vulnerability in software used by the company allowed an unauthorized actor to access confidential customer information.
The Mission Essential Group (MEG) files a notice of data breach after discovering that certain MEG email accounts may have been accessed by an unauthorized party.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW)
Description: Reports begin to emerge about a MOVEit data breach at the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW) resulting in an unauthorized party being able to access patients’ sensitive information.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: Teachers’ Retirement System of the City of New York
Description: The Teachers’ Retirement System of the City of New York posts notice of a PBI data security incident on its website.

The major gaming platform Roblox has suffered a major data breach, leading to the release of personal information including addresses from those who attended the Roblox Developer Conference between 2017-2020.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to confartigianatofc.it

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Rotomail.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to CWS.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Artemide.

Author: Unidentified Chinese Threat Actor
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that an unidentified espionage-focused hacking group believed to be aligned to the Chinese government is behind recent attacks against Citrix NetScaler application delivery controller (ADC) appliances exploiting CVE-2023-3519.

Author: Akira
Description: Yamaha Music Canada suffers a ransomware attack by the Akira group.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The United Kingdom arm of DHL is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The American Civil Liberties Union Foundation confirms that the Clop Ransomware gang, exploiting the vulnerability in MOVEit Transfer accessed the  information of about 575 people.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Mary Kay Corporation is added to the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang exploiting the CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Bates Technical College confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Lake Sumter Community College confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University at Buffalo confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The University at Buffalo confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: State University of New York at Fredonia (SUNY Freedonia)
Description: The State University of New York at Fredonia (SUNY Freedonia) confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Olympic College confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The St. Petersburg College confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability against the National Student Clearinghouse.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Massachusetts Mutual Life (MassMutual) joins the list of the victims of the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 exploitation by the Clop ransomware group.
Researchers from Checkmarx disclose the first example of a bank targeted by open-source software supply chain attacks.
Researchers from Checkmarx disclose an additional example of a bank targeted by open-source software supply chain attacks.

Researchers from McAfee observe a smishing campaign against Japanese Android users posing as a power and water infrastructure company, alerting victims about payment problems to lure them to a phishing website to infect the target devices with a remote-controlled SpyNote malware.
American United Life Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential consumer information in the company’s care was subject to unauthorized access.
New England Life Care (NELC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that certain files on the company’s computer network were unauthorized.
Lancaster Orthopedic Group discloses an unauthorized access to its network.
Paramedic Billing Services announces that it fell victim to a cyberattack in late May 2023.
Attackers exploit two separate vulnerabilities in as many days to steal more than $3.2 million from Conic Finance.
The institutional webistes of the Italian region of Umbra are hit with a DDoS attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Cognisight files a notice of data breach on behalf of SeniorCare PACE (Sutter Senior Care) after confirming that confidential data belonging to Sutter Senior Care patients was exposed as a result of a vulnerability in MOVEit.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Sovos Compliance files a notice of data breach on behalf of Northwestern Mutual after discovering that the secure file transfer program used by Sovos contained a vulnerability resulting in an unauthorized party being able to access files on the company’s MOVEit server.
Buckingham County Public Schools sends notifications to parents of 86 students after a compromise of a district’s business email account.

Author: Lazarus Group AKA Jade Sleet and TraderTraitor
Description: Blockchain analysts blame the North Korean Lazarus hacking group for an attack on payment processing platform Alphapo where the attackers stole almost $60 million in crypto.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Mattress giant Tempur Sealy is hit with a ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware attack forcing system shutdown.

Target: Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population
Description: An ‘established’ threat actor claims to be in possession of two million data records stolen from the Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Akira
Description: The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) warns local organizations against the risks of the Akira ransomware.

Author: Cyclops
Description: The Cyclops ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Cvlan, an IT service provider, and dumps 1,25GB of data.
The Norwegian government warns that its ICT platform used by 12 ministries suffered a cyberattack after hackers exploited a zero-day vulnerability in third-party software.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Apple patches a new Kernel flaw tracked as CVE-2023-38606 exploited in attacks targeting devices running older iOS releases.

US-based IT software company Ivanti patches CVE-2023-35078, an actively exploited zero-day authentication bypass vulnerability impacting its Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) mobile device management software (formerly MobileIron Core).

Author: Lazarus Group AKA Jade Sleet and TraderTraitor
Description: Researchers from AhnLab Security Emergency response Center (ASEC) discover that Lazarus, a threat group deemed to be nationally funded, is attacking Windows Internet Information Service (IIS) web servers and using them as distribution points for their malware.

Author: Haixun
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that a new wave of HaiEnergy, a Chinese influence campaign, used newswire services, staged protests, and billboard ads to spread pro-Beijing propaganda in the U.S.

Author: Spyhide
Description: phone surveillance app called Spyhide is stealthily collecting private phone data from tens of thousands of Android devices around the world, new data shows.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Michigan State University (MSU) posts a notice on its website describing a third-party data breach that occurred at two vendors used by the University: the Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association (TIAA) and the National Student Clearinghouse (“NSC”) both data breaches were related to the file transfer program MOVEit, resulting in the potential exposure of student and retiree data.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Johns Hopkins All Children's Hospital is targeted a cyber attack exploiting the MOVEit vulnerability.
U.S. law firm Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan has data from a limited number of clients potentially stolen following a ransomware attack against its third-party data center provider last year.

Author: UAC-0006
Description: The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) warns of a new campaign by the threat actor tracked as UAC-0006 delivering the SmokeLoader malware to domestic organizations.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Azimut Capital Management confirms to have suffered an ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware attack.

Author: Space Pirates
Target: 16 Government agencies, educational institutions, private security companies, aerospace manufacturers, agricultural producers, defense, energy, and healthcare firms in Russia and Serbia.
Description: Researchers from Positive Technologies reveal that the threat actor known as Space Pirates has been linked to attacks against at least 16 organizations in Russia and Serbia over the past year by employing novel tactics and adding new cyber weapons to its arsenal.

Author: Realst

Description: CardioComm Solutions, a Canadian provider of consumer and professional-grade heart monitoring technologies, is taken down by an ongoing cybersecurity incident.

Author: Casbaneiro (AKA Metamorfo and Ponteiro)
Description: Researchers from Sygnia discover a new campaign of the Casbaneiro banking malware, making use of a User Account Control (UAC) bypass technique to gain full administrative privileges on a machine.

Author: FraudGPT
Description: Threat actors are advertising yet another cybercrime generative artificial intelligence (AI) tool dubbed FraudGPT on various dark web marketplaces and Telegram channels.

Author: Decoy Dog
Target: Organizations in Russia and Eastern Europe
Description: Researchers from Infoblox reveal new details about Decoy Dog, a largely undetected sophisticated toolkit likely used for at least a year in cyber intelligence operations, relying on the domain name system (DNS) for command and control activity.
Care N’ Care Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that the confidential information of tens of thousands of patients was compromised in a cybersecurity incident.
Valley National Bank files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential data that had been provided to the bank was compromised.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: UnitedHealthcare Student Resources (Student Resources) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information stored on the organization’s MOVEit server.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Johns Hopkins University and the Johns Hopkins Health System Corporation (collectively “Johns Hopkins'') file a notice of data breach on behalf of the Kennedy Krieger Institute after learning that a software vulnerability resulted in confidential consumer information being leaked.

Aurora National Life Assurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that an incident at a third-party vendor resulted in confidential consumer information being exposed to unauthorized access.

Target: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Newark
Description: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Newark confirms that unauthorized individuals gained access to some of its computer systems.
Cheyenne Radiology Group & MRI issues notifications to its patients about a ransomware attack that was discovered and stopped on December 12, 2022.

Target: Life Management Center of Northwest Florida
Description: Life Management Center of Northwest Florida experiences a data security incident that may have involved personal and / or protected health information belonging to certain current and former patients and employees.
Decentralized lending protocol Era Lend is the victim of a cyberattack, losing $3.4 million.

Author: Nitrogen
Target: Several organizations in the technology and non-profit sectors in North America
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal the details of a new 'Nitrogen' initial access malware campaign using Google and Bing search ads to promote fake software sites that infect unsuspecting users with Cobalt Strike and ransomware payloads.

Author: SiegedSec
Target: NATO Communities of Interest (COI) Cooperation Portal
Description: NATO confirms that its IT team is investigating claims about an alleged data-theft hack on the Communities of Interest (COI) Cooperation Portal (dnbl.ncia.nato.int) by the hacking group known as SiegedSec.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: U.S. government contractor Maximus confirms that the Clop Ransomware gang, exploiting the vulnerability in MOVEit Transfer accessed the protected health information of as many as 11 million individuals.

Author: Lazarus Group AKA Jade Sleet and TraderTraitor
Description: Estonian crypto-payments service provider CoinsPaid announces that it experienced a cyber attack that resulted in the theft of $37,200,000 worth of cryptocurrency, blaming the attack on the North Korean hacking group Lazarus.

Author: U.S.?
Description: China accuses U.S. of hacking the Wuhan Earthquake Monitoring Center.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Akira
Description: Researchers from Arctic Wolf reveal that the recently discovered Akira ransomware is actively targeting small and medium-sized businesses around the world, with the main focus on the U.S. and Canada.
Researcgers from Greynoise observe the first attempts to exploit CVE-2023-24489, a recent critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Citrix ShareFile.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the actively exploited Ivanti ‘s Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2023-35078, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.
Family Vision of Anderson files a notice of data breach after a ransomware attack exposed confidential patient information to unauthorized access

HRM Enterprises, owner of the US's largest independent hardware store, is hit by a cyberattack resulting in the credit cards of more than 40K clients being stolen after HRM’s ecommerce platform provider, Commerce V3, is breached.

Target: Players of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2
Description: Attackers are infecting players of an old Call of Duty game with a worm that spreads automatically in online lobbies, according to two analyses of the malware.

Author: Fenix
Target: Tax-paying individuals in Mexico and Chile
Description: Researchers from Metabase Q reveal that tax-paying individuals in Mexico and Chile are being targeted by a Mexico-based cybercrime group that goes by the name Fenix to breach targeted networks and steal valuable data.

Researchers from Aqua Security reveal that misconfigured and poorly secured Apache Tomcat servers are being targeted as part of a new campaign designed to deliver the Mirai botnet malware and cryptocurrency miners dropping a web shell script dubbed "neww."

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Gallivan, the provider of the student health, dental, and wellness program for students at the University of Guelph, notifies students of a data breach which included access to personal information, occurred exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability.

Author: Patchwork (AKA Dropping Elephant, Chinastrats, Monsoon, Sarit, Quilted Tiger, APT-C-09, and ZINC EMERSON)
Target: Universities and research organizations in China
Description: Researchers from Knownsec 404 discover a campaign carried out by threat actors associated with the hacking crew known as Patchwork, targeting universities and research organizations in China using a backdoor codenamed EyeShell.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Deloitte confirms to be among the victims of a ctyber intrusion occurred exploiting the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Hallmark Channel joins the list of the victims that the Russian ransomware crew Clop claims to have compromised via the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Transactions Applications Group joins the list of the victims that the Russian ransomware crew Clop claims to have compromised via the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The College of Collin joins the list of the victims that the Russian ransomware crew Clop claims to have compromised via the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The College of Foothill joins the list of the victims that the Russian ransomware crew Clop claims to have compromised via the MOVEit vulnerability.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The College of Lake Forest joins the list of the victims that the Russian ransomware crew Clop claims to have compromised via the MOVEit vulnerability.
CRC Insurance Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had accessed several employee email accounts.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: VALIC Retirement Services Company (VRSCO, VALIC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that one of the company’s vendors experienced a MOVEit data breach resulting in confidential client information being leaked.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Pension Benefit Information (PBI) files a notice of data breach on behalf of Transamerica Life Insurance Company after confirming that a vulnerability in the file-transfer program MOVEit resulted in confidential information of Transamerica Life customers being leaked.

Author: DESORDEN Group
Description: DESORDEN Group claims responsibility for an attack disrupting the activities of Ranhill Utilities Berhad, a conglomerate providing water and power supply in Malaysia, affecting over 1 million customers.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to GF Assicurazioni.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Target: T. Rowe Price Retirement Plan Services
Description: T. Rowe Price Retirement Plan Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that hackers accessed a MOVEit server belonging to Pension Benefit Information (PBI), one of TRP’s third-party vendors.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: CareSource notifies of a data breach involving the company’s use of the MOVEit file transfer application.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Safilo Group, an Italian manufacturer of eyeglasses, joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware gang.

Author: APT29 (AKA Cozy Bear, Cloaked Ursa, BlueBravo, Midnight Blizzard, and formerly Nobelium)
Target: Government entities in Europe with interest in Ukraine
Description: Ssecurity researchers at Recorded Future unearth a cyber espionage campaign by the Russian threat actor APT29 targeting government-sector entities in Europe with interest in Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2023-38750 Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) vulnerability, to the list of exploited vulnerabilities.
Synergy Healthcare Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor had gained access to portions of the company’s computer network.

Author: APT34 AKA OilRig
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of a new campaign by the Iranian threat Actor APT34 targeting an IT company in the UAE for gaining access to government targets inside the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

Author: Mysterious Elephant
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a cluster of activity focusing on Pakistani victims by a threat actor dubbed “Mysterious Elephant.”

Author: Lazarus Group?
Description: Researchers from ReversingLabs uncover evidence of more malicious npm packages, with links to the infrastructure used to launch the attack against JumpCloud, which also appear to target cryptocurrency providers.

Researchers from Dr.Web reveal thast t\hreat actors are creating fake websites hosting trojanized software installers to trick unsuspecting users into downloading a downloader malware called Fruity with the goal of installing remote trojans tools like Remcos RAT.
Fidelity Life Association files a notice of data breach after discovering that confidential consumer information that had been entrusted to the company was subject to unauthorized access.
IMX Medical Management Services confirms that malware was found on a laptop computer that potentially allowed unauthorized individuals to access the protected health information of 7,594 individuals
LifeWorks Wellness Center recently reports a data breach that has affected 17,000 patients, after attackers gained access to its internal file system.
UC Davis Health confirms that the email account of an employee had been accessed by an unauthorized individual.

Author: CherryBlos
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new Android malware family named 'CherryBlos' on Google Play, aiming to steal cryptocurrency credentials and funds or conduct scams and using OCR to steal credentials from images.

Author: FakeTrade
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new Android malware family named 'FakeTrade' on Google Play, connected to the previous one, aiming to steal cryptocurrency credentials and funds or conduct scams.

Author: Indian APT group 'Bahamut'
Target: individuals in the South Asia region
Description: Researchers from CYFIRMA reveal that attackers are using a fake Android app named 'SafeChat' to infect devices with spyware malware that steals call logs, texts, and GPS locations from phones.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company confirms that the Clop Ransomware gang, exploiting the vulnerability in MOVEit Transfer accessed the protected health information of about 873,000 people.

Author: Attackers allegedly connected to the North Korean government (APT37)
Description: Researchers from Securonix reveal the details STARK#MULE, a campaign carried out by attackers allegedly connected to the North Korean government, using fake U.S. military job-recruitment documents to lure people into downloading malware staged on legitimate, but compromised, South Korean e-commerce sites.
Ivanti warns customers about CVE-2023-35081, a second zero-day vulnerability in its Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) product that has been exploited in targeted attacks.
Researchers from Bitdefender Labs discover a malicious phishing campaign trying to infect users with the infamous Agent Tesla remote access Trojan.

Author: Karakurt
Description: The Chattanooga Heart Institute notifies more than 170,000 patients and others that hackers may have stolen their sensitive personal and medical information in a cyberattack detected in April. The Karakurt ransomware group claimed credit for the hack a month later.

Author: Predasus
Description: IBM Security Lab discover a new malware, “Predasus,”  designed to inject malicious code through a Chrome extension to target banking users.

Author: IcedID
Description: Researchers from Team Cymru discover a new campaign by the threat actors linked to the malware loader known as IcedID with an updated module used for post-compromise activity on hacked systems.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Teachers Retirement System of Georgia (TRS) posts a notice of data breach after discovering that PBI Research Services (PBI), a third-party vendor used by TRS, experienced a data breach related to the company’s use of MOVEit.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, files a notice of data breach after confirming that a vulnerability in MOVEit, a file-transfer program used by Allegheny County, resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access confidential consumer information.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) notified 612,000 Medicare beneficiaries of a data breach stemming from a vulnerability in Progress Software’s MOVEit Transfer software.
United Healthcare Services files a notice of data breach. As a result of the incident, an unauthorized party was able to access sensitive information belonging to 398,319 individuals.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Kenya's eCitizen Portal suffers a huge DDoS attack that affects services on the key government online platform eCitizen for almost a week.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Black Basta
Description: BankCard USA pays a $50,000 ransom to the Black Basta group after suffering a ransomware attack.

Author: Hive
Description: The MHMR Authority of Brazos Valley reveals to have suffered a Hive ransomware attack.

Author: China (Volt Typhoon)
Description: According to sources of the U.S. government, China has implanted malware in key U.S. power and communications networks in a “ticking time bomb” that could disrupt the military in event of a conflict,

Author: Abyss Locker
Description: The Abyss Locker ransomware operation is the latest to develop a Linux encryptor to target VMware's ESXi virtual machines platform in attacks on the enterprise.

Attackers are actively exploiting a 'BleedingPipe' remote code execution vulnerability in Minecraft mods to run malicious commands on servers and clients, allowing them to take control of the devices.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Brighthouse Financial confirms to have suffered a data breach occurred exploiting the MOVEit CVE-2023-34362 vulnerability.

Author: Iranian hacktivist group, 'Cyber Avengers' AKA 'CyberAv3ngers'
Description: Website of Israel's largest oil refinery operator, BAZAN Group is inaccessible from most parts of the world as threat actors claim to have hacked the Group's cyber systems.
Decentralized Finance (DeFi) platform Curve Finance says in a post-mortem that at least $61 million worth of cryptocurrency was stolen from the platform through a vulnerability in the Vyper language.
Decentralized Finance (DeFi) platform Ellipsis is also victim of a theft of crypto assets exploiting the vulnerability in the Vyper language.
Decentralized Finance (DeFi) platform Alchemix is also victim of a theft of crypto assets exploiting the vulnerability in the Vyper language.
Decentralized Finance (DeFi) platform Alchemix is also victim of a theft of crypto assets exploiting the vulnerability in the Vyper language.

Author: SkidMap
Description: Researchers from Trustwave reveal that vulnerable Redis services are being targeted by a "new, improved, dangerous" variant of a malware called SkidMap that's engineered to target a wide range of Linux distributions.

Author: Threat actors from Iran
Target: State employees and researchers in Israel
Description: The Israeli Shin Bet security agency reveals to have uncovered an Iranian phishing campaign against Israeli civilians in recent months, mostly targeting state employees and researchers, in a bid to obtain intelligence on state policy.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: APT31 AKA Judgment Panda, Zirconium, Bronze Vinewood, Red Keres
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that Chinese state-sponsored hackers have been targeting industrial organizations with new malware that can steal data from air-gapped systems.

Author: TA544 and TA551
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover WikiLoader, a new malware strain aimed at Italian organizations through several phishing campaigns.

Author: SpyNote
Description: Researchers from Cleafy observe an extensive campaign against multiple European customers of different banks carried out via the SpyNote Android spyware.

Author: Meow
Description: Researcher from Aqua Security discover a new 'Meow' campaign targeting misconfigured Jupyter Notebook instances.
MW Components files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access certain information contained on its computer network after a ransomware attack.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505 and FIN11
Description: Prudential Insurance Company of America files a notice of data breach after discovering that one of the company’s vendors (PBI) experienced a data breach related to the file transfer program MOVEit.

Author: Karakurt
Description: The McAlester Regional Health Center is targeted by the Karakurt ransomware group claiming to have stolen over 126GB of data from the facility, including a swath of DNA patient records to be auctioned off to the highest bidder.

Author: UsNsA
Description: Researchers from CloudSEK discover a post on an English speaking cybercrime forum, sharing a database of PHI-IIIT Delhi for Forum credits. A total of 82 Databases were compromised and leaked data.
Tecnova Group suffers a cyber attack leading to the exfiltration of 7GB of data, of which 800MB are leaked.
